direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve converting a jsoup DOM to a W3C DOM with similar control flows and exception handling.
Both methods handle document conversion, with 'convert' focusing on DOM structure and 'asString' on serialization.
Both methods interact with W3C Document objects, though 'selectXpath' focuses on querying the document.
Both methods handle null parameters and throw exceptions in a similar manner.
Both methods depend on handling and converting map data structures, though in different contexts.
